alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin County through 515 PM CDT... At 451 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cowan, or 7 miles southeast of Winchester, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Decherd, Cowan, Sewanee, St. Andrews and Sherwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
